hint.text: Represent the given number as a product of its prime factors

solution.text:
\(_{{(j**m)*(k**n)*(l**o)}}_\)
\(=_{{str(j) + ('\\times' + str(j))*(m-1)}}_ \times _{{str(k) + ('\\times' + str(k))*(n-1)}}_ _{{'\\times' + str(l) + ('\\times' + str(l))*(o-1) if (o>0) else ''}}_\)
\(\)
\(\)
Therefore, \(_{{3 if (o>0) else 2}}_\) distinct prime factors exist for \(_{{(j**m)*(k**n)*(l**o)}}_\).

content.text: How many distinct prime factors exist for \(_{{(j**m)*(k**n)*(l**o)}}_\)?
